title: Probing the mechanism of guest–framework bonding interactions through a first-principles study on the structural and electronic properties of type-II clathrate AxSi136 (A = Na, K, Rb; 0 ≤ x ≤ 24) under pressure
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,20220-20229
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA02112F, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Dong Xue, Yanbin Deng, Charles W. Myles
The ionic bonding nature can be detected for Na@Si28 case. Somewhat covalent bonding formation due to the resultant competition between the multiatomic repulsive interaction and Coulomb attractive force is observed for Na@Si20 case.
